column2: MICHIGAN DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column6: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 2. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column6: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column8: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column10: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.

column2: 3. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
4. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 5. The yield sign means:
column4: Go. The light will soon be red.
column6: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 6. When you approach this sign, you must:
column6: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 7. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
8. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column6: in the direction you want to go.
column8: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column10: to keep the front wheels straight.

column2: 9. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must not drive past this sign.
column6: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column10: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.

column2: 10. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 11. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column6: remove the sign and move forward.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column10: look for a detour or another route.

column2: 12. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column8: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column10: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 13. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column6: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column8: call a taxi if you've been drinking.

column2: 14. This signal means:
15. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 16. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
17. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
18. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column6: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 19. This road sign means:

20. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
21. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column8: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column10: speed up to beat the red light.

column2: 22. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column6: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column8: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column10: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
24. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 25. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column8: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 26. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
27. This road sign means:
28. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column6: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 29. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: pass the car on the left.
column6: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column8: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column10: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.

column2: 30. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 31. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
32. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
33. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column6: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column10: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.

column2: 34. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: The same as a steady yellow light.
column8: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 35. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column10: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 36. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column10: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.

column2: 37. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column4: only on the left and right side

column2: 38. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
39. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column8: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 41. Braking distance is affected by:
column4: the condition of your brakes and tires.
column8: the speed your vehicle is traveling.

column2: 42. A flashing yellow light means:
43. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column8: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 44. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
45. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 46. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
47. Arrows on the roadway:
column8: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.
column10: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 48. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 49. This road sign means:
column6: Cars in right lane must slow down
column10: Pass only in the right lane

column2: 50. Passing is prohibited:
column4: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
